# Appendix 1: Technical Methodology

Let (T\_{j,t}) be the set of completed trips in area (j) during period (t).\
Each trip (i \in T\_{j,t}) has a unique trip ID and a vehicle ID (v_i).\
All formulas below use Trip Database data unless stated otherwise.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Demand Factor

### Trip Volume

\[ TV\_{j,t} = \|T\_{j,t}\| \]

### Trip Revenue

\[ TR\_{j,t} = \sum*{i* \in T{j,t}} r_i \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Accessibility Factor

### Number of Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles (WAVs)

#### 1. Active Registered Accessible Vehicles

\[ WAV\^{(1)}*{j,t} = \|R*{j,t} \cap V\_{j,t}\| \]

#### 2. Active Accessible Vehicles Providing Accessible Trips

\[ WAV\^{(2)}*{j,t} = \|R*{j,t} \cap V\_{j,t} \cap A\_{j,t}\| \]

#### Per 1,000 Persons

\[ WAV\^{per1}*{j,t} =* \frac{WAV^{(1)}_{j,t}}{P_{j,t}} \times 1000 \] \[ WAV\^{per2}{j,t} = \frac{WAV^{(2)}_{j,t}}{P_{j,t}} \times 1000 \]

### Active Vehicles per 1,000 Persons

\[ \text{ActiveVehicles}\_{j,t} = \frac{|V_{j,t}|}{P_{j,t}} \times 1000 \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Affordability Factor

### Fare per Kilometre

\[ f_i = \frac{r_i}{d_i} \]

Percentiles (10th, 50th, 90th) of the distribution of (f_i) are reported.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Safety Factor

No indicators computed.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Service Quality Factor

### Wait Time

\[ w_i = t_i\^p - t_i\^h \]

Median wait time is reported.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Competition Factor

### Herfindahl–Hirschman Index (HHI)

\[ HHI\_{j,t} = \sum*{i=1}\^{n} s*{i,j,t}\^{,2} \]

### Theil Index

\[ T = \sum\_{i=1}\^{n} \left(\frac{x_i}{\mu}\right) \ln\left(\frac{x_i}{\mu}\right) \]

### Theil Decomposition

\[ T = B + W \]

Where: \[ B = \sum\_{j=1}\^{k} \left( \frac{n_j}{n} \frac{y_j}{y} \ln\left(\frac{y_j}{y}\right) \right) \]

\[ W = \sum*{j=1}\^{k}* \left( \frac{y_j}{y} \sum{i=1}\^{n_j} \frac{y_{ij}}{y_j} \ln\left(\frac{y_{ij}}{y_j}\right) \right) \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Innovation Factor

No analysis conducted.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Sustainability Factor

### Revenue per Active Vehicle

\[ RevPerVehicle\_{j,t} = \frac{TR_{j,t}}{|V_{j,t}|} \]

### Taxi Fleet Utilization

\[ FleetUtilization\_{i,t} = \frac{AV_{i,t}}{Capacity_{i,t}} \]

### Taxi Vehicle Occupancy Rate (VOR)

\[ VOR = \frac{D_{i,t}}{L_{i,t}} \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## New Vehicle Occupancy Rate (Shift-Based Method)

Define a **shift** as a sequence of trips where each trip starts within 60 minutes of the previous trip’s end.

### Shift Start & End

\[ t\^{shift}*{start} =* \min*i(t\^{vehicle}*{assign,i}) \] \[ t\^{shift}{end} = \max*i(t\^{dropoff}*{arrive,i}) \]

### Shift Length

\[ L\^{shift} = t\^{shift}*{end} - t\^{shift}*{start} \]

### Shift Occupancy

\[ D\^{shift} = \sum\_{i=1}\^{n} D_i \]

### Average VOR

\[ VOR = \frac{D_{i,t}}{L_{i,t}} \]

### Vehicle Occupancy Rate Possible Range (VORPR)

\[ VORPR = \frac{D_{i,t}}{O_{i,t}} \]

Where operating time: \[ O_i = t\^{dropoff}*{arrive,i} - t\^{vehicle}*{assign,i} \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Drivers’ Gross Hourly Earnings

\[ GHE\_{j,t} = \text{Median} \left( \frac{\sum_{i \in T_{j,t}} r_i} {\sum*{i* \in T{j,t}} h_i} \right) \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Number of Active Drivers

\[ DR\_{j,t} = \|{ dr_i \mid i \in T\_{j,t} }\| \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Peak-Hour Taxi Vehicle Occupancy Rate

Peak hour identified as hour with the largest trip volume.

\[ PeakVOR\_{i,t} = \frac{D^{peak}_{i,t}}{L^{peak}_{i,t}} \]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Variety Factor

No analysis conducted.
